title: 2025 Aston Martin Vanquish launch on March 22
description: The new Aston Martin Vanquish will launch in India on March 22. First revealed in 2024, the Aston Martin Grand Tourer is a replacement for the DBS Superleggera and directly rivals the Ferrari 12Cilindri. The new Vanquish has a 5.2-litre twin-turbo V12 engine 0-100kph takes 3.2 seconds; top speed is limited to 345kph 2025 Aston Martin Vanquish engine and performance 835hp 5.2-litre petrol engine A 5.2-litre twin-turbocharged V12 engine powers the Vanquish, producing a whopping 835hp and 1,000Nm of torque. This petrol block is paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission that sends the output to the rear wheels. The 0-100kph sprint comes in just 3.2 seconds, and the top speed is 345kph.  2025 Aston Martin Vanquish design and interior features Exterior Vanquish’s front gets the signature vaned grille, Matrix LED headlights and two large air vents on the bonnet. A black splitter under the front bumper adds to the overall aggressive look. Towards the side, the GT’s 21-inch forged wheels wear bespoke Pirelli P Zero tyres, which fill the wheel arches well. Vertically stacked LED tail-lights form a unique pattern and are bridged by a black panel housing the Aston Martin emblem. Interior Inside, the 2025 Vanquish is equipped with a 10.25-inch touchscreen, which gets wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. Other features include a 1,170-watt 15-speaker Bowers & Wilkins sound system, a wireless phone charger and an ADAS suite. 2025 Aston Martin Vanquish price expectation We expect Aston Martin to price its Vanquish flagship at over Rs 6 crore, ex-showroom, without options. Stay tuned to Autocar India for Vanquish’s launch updates and review.  Also, see: Aston Martin Vantage Roadster, Vanquish India launch in 2025 New Aston Martin Vanquish revealed as 835hp V12 flagship

html:
The Vanquish will be Aston Martin’s flagship offering in India.

The new Aston Martin Vanquish will launch in India on March 22. First revealed in 2024, the Aston Martin Grand Tourer is a replacement for the DBS Superleggera and directly rivals the Ferrari 12Cilindri.

  1. The new Vanquish has a 5.2-litre twin-turbo V12 engine
  2. 0-100kph takes 3.2 seconds; top speed is limited to 345kph

2025 Aston Martin Vanquish engine and performance

835hp 5.2-litre petrol engine

A 5.2-litre twin-turbocharged V12 engine powers the Vanquish, producing a whopping 835hp and 1,000Nm of torque. This petrol block is paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission that sends the output to the rear wheels. The 0-100kph sprint comes in just 3.2 seconds, and the top speed is 345kph. 

2025 Aston Martin Vanquish design and interior features

Exterior

Vanquish’s front gets the signature vaned grille, Matrix LED headlights and two large air vents on the bonnet. A black splitter under the front bumper adds to the overall aggressive look.

Towards the side, the GT’s 21-inch forged wheels wear bespoke Pirelli P Zero tyres, which fill the wheel arches well. Vertically stacked LED tail-lights form a unique pattern and are bridged by a black panel housing the Aston Martin emblem.

Interior

Inside, the 2025 Vanquish is equipped with a 10.25-inch touchscreen, which gets wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. Other features include a 1,170-watt 15-speaker Bowers & Wilkins sound system, a wireless phone charger and an ADAS suite.

2025 Aston Martin Vanquish price expectation

We expect Aston Martin to price its Vanquish flagship at over Rs 6 crore, ex-showroom, without options. Stay tuned to Autocar India for Vanquish’s launch updates and review.
